summary: LocalBuddy website to connect students/migrants/low-income users with local street-food vendors, using a free street map; includes separate user and vendor components with a high-level interactive interface.
architectural_notes: Product concept: direct street-vendor-to-customer discovery for affordable food targeting students, migrants, and newcomers to a city.
Core UX split: separate customer/user experience and vendor experience.
Mapping requirement: use a free street map provider for vendor discovery/navigation.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- LocalBuddy wordmark logo, warm earthy palette, simple readable typography (localbuddy-logo.dim_512x256.png)
- Friendly hero illustration of a street-food stall and diverse customers in a simple flat style (localbuddy-hero.dim_1600x900.png)

existing_features.title: Create a LocalBuddy frontend information architecture with two clear entry points: (1) Customer/User portal and (2) Vendor portal, including a simple landing page that explains the service and routes users into the correct portal.

Implement the Customer/User portal UI to browse nearby vendors on a free street map and via a list view, with interactive vendor detail panels (vendor info, menu items, price range, hours, and directions link).
Implement the Vendor portal UI that allows a vendor to create and manage their vendor profile and menu (add/edit/remove menu items and set a map location).
Wire the frontend to the backend using React Query for data fetching/caching, including loading states, empty states, and basic error handling for all primary screens.

Add a coherent, modern visual theme for LocalBuddy (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) that feels friendly and accessible for students and newcomers, and apply it consistently across landing, Customer, and Vendor portals.
Add generated static brand assets and use them in the UI (logo and a hero illustration) by placing them under frontend/public/assets/generated and referencing them directly from the frontend.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build LocalBuddy web UI with two main components/portals: Customer/User and Vendor
Integrate free street map for discovering nearby street vendors and navigating to them
Create a high-level, interactive, visually polished interface suitable to paste into an existing repo
Add a Motoko backend data model and APIs to store vendor profiles, vendor locations (latitude/longitude), and menu items, and to query vendors for the Customer portal.
